required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: iNO as Salvage Treatment of Hypoxemia After TAAD Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Inhaled Nitric Oxide as Salvage Treatment of Hypoxemia After Type A Acute Aortic Dissection Surgery (INSTEAD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to clarify the possible mechanism of hypoxemia after surgical treatment of type A acute aortic dissection and the possible mechanism of the treatment role of inhaled nitric oxide in refractory hypoxemia.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators' previous study has stressed that inhaled nitric oxide therapy might play an ameliorative role in patients with refractory hypoxemia after surgical treatment of type A acute aortic dissection. The possible reason might be the decreasing of intrapulmonary shunt because previous studies showed that inhaled nitric oxide could decrease intrapulmonary shunt by selectively dilating the pulmonary vessels in ventilated areas. As a result, the investigators designed this observational study to calculate the intrapulmonary shunt before and after inhaled nitric oxide therapy. Intrapulmonary shunt was calculated from oxygen content (CO2) of different sites ( artery, mixed venous, alveolar capillary) by Fick equation:(CaO2-CcO2)/(CvO2-CcO2). A FiO2 of 1.0 and tidal volume of 6~8 ml/kg were chosen. Oxygen content was calculated from hemoglobin (Hb), oxygen saturation (SO2) and oxygen partial pressure (PO2) by the following equation: CO2 = 1.34*Hb*SO2 + 0,0031*PO2. PaO2, SaO2, PvO2 and SvO2 were measured from arterial and mixed venous blood samples taken from the radial arterial catheter and from the pulmonary artery catheter. ScO2 was estimated to be 1.0 with a FiO2 of 100%. PcO2 was considered to be the same as PAO2 (partial pressure of oxygen in the alveoli), and was calculated from the alveolar gas equation with PAO2 = [(atmospheric pressure - 47) * (FiO2)] - PaCO2/0.8.Other variables such as hemodynamic variables from pulmonary artery catheter were also collected.

primary_outcome.measure: Intrapulmonary shunt with a PEEP of 5 cm H2O
primary_outcome.description: intrapulmonary shunt calculated by Fick equation with a PEEP of 5 cm H2O

primary_outcome.measure: Intrapulmonary shunt with a PEEP of 10 cm H2O
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after increasing PEEP to 10cm H2O
primary_outcome.description: intrapulmonary shunt calculated by Fick equation with a PEEP of 10 cm H2O

primary_outcome.measure: Intrapulmonary shunt with a PEEP of 10 cm H2O and inhaled nitric oxide
primary_outcome.description: intrapulmonary shunt calculated by Fick equation with a PEEP of 10 cm H2O and inhaled nitric oxide

primary_outcome.measure: Intrapulmonary shunt with inhaled nitric oxide and a PEEP of 5 cm H2O
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after decreasing PEEP to 5cm H2O
primary_outcome.description: intrapulmonary shunt calculated by Fick equation with inhaled nitric oxide and a PEEP of 5 cm H2O

secondary_outcome.measure: cardiac output collected from PAC with a PEEP of 5 cm H2O
pulmonary artery pressure collected from PAC with a PEEP of 5 cm H2O
pulmonary artery wedge pressure collected from PAC with a PEEP of 5 cm H2O
secondary_outcome.description: pulmonary artery wedge pressure in mmHg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after increasing PEEP to 10cm H2O

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after increasing PEEP to 10cm H2O
secondary_outcome.description: pulmonary artery wedge pressure in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: cardiac output collected from PAC with a PEEP of 10 cm H2O and inhaled nitric oxide

secondary_outcome.measure: pulmonary artery pressure collected from PAC with inhaled nitric oxide and a PEEP of 5 cm H2O

arm_group.description: post-surgical type A acute aortic dissection patients was ventilated with a PEEP of 5cm H2O, without inhaled nitric oxide
post-surgical type A acute aortic dissection patients was ventilated with a PEEP of 10cm H2O, without inhaled nitric oxide
post-surgical type A acute aortic dissection patients was ventilated with a PEEP of 10cm H2O, with inhaled nitric oxide
post-surgical type A acute aortic dissection patients was ventilated with a PEEP of 5cm H2O, with inhaled nitric oxide

study_pop.textblock: post-surgical type A aortic dissection patients with hypoxemia
